Authors:
FRANCISCA ANDRï¿½A DA SILVA OLIVEIRA, Francois Michonneau,
TITO MONTEIRO DA CRUZ LOTUFO
Title: Molecular Phylogeny of Didemnidae (Ascidiacea:Tunicata)
Journal: Zoological Journal of the Linnean Society
Keywords:
Aplousobranchia, Didemnum, mitochondrial DNA, nuclear
DNA
Abstract:
Didemnidae is the largest family of tunicates within
Aplousobranchia, with about 578 species thus far described. This family
comprises eight genera: Atriolum, Clitella, Didemnum, Diplosoma,
Leptoclinides, Lissoclinum, Polysyncraton and Trididemnum. Morphological
and molecular data suggest that Didemnidae are monophyletic, but the
monophyly of each didemnid genus and their phylogenetic relationships
are still poorly understood. This study aimed at evaluating the
monophyly of six of the eight didemnid genera, based on mitochondrial
(COI) and nuclear (18S) sequences. All genera were recovered as
monophyletic, except Trididemnum. Didemnum is comprised of two clades
that can be distinguished by the presence of an atrial lip, the number
of testicular lobes, and the number of ampullae in larvae. These
morphological differences support a new taxon within Didemnum.
Morphological evidence and previous taxonomists have suggested a close
relationship between Didemnum and Polysyncraton, as well as between
Diplosoma and Lissoclinum. We re-evaluate these hypotheses, which are
supported by our 18S sequences and concatenated data.
